meanings.definition: A religious house or community under the rule of a preceptor.
meanings.sent1: The preceptories in the village were known for their peaceful way of life.
meanings.sent2: The preceptories were established to provide spiritual guidance to the local population.
meanings.sent3: The preceptories decided to have a bake-off to raise funds for charity.
meanings.sent4: The preceptories stood tall like guardians of ancient wisdom.
meanings.sent5: Visiting the preceptories felt like stepping into a serene sanctuary.

meanings.definition: The office or position of a preceptor.
meanings.sent1: She was honored to be appointed to the preceptories within the organization.
meanings.sent2: The preceptories oversaw the training and development of new recruits.
meanings.sent3: The preceptories held a contest to see who could give the best advice.
meanings.sent4: In the world of education, the preceptories were seen as mentors and guides.
meanings.sent5: His preceptorial duties at the preceptories involved teaching and mentoring the younger members.
